content.value:
in multipart/form-data posts a file's filename is optional - it really is. At best it's a "should" and then only when the filename matters.

Why do so many APIs make this mandatory? I just created a binary object on the fly, there's the content type- it didn't come from a file!
content.html: in multipart/form-data posts a file's filename is optional - it really is. At best it's a "should" and then only when the filename matters. Why do so many APIs make this mandatory? I just created a binary object on the fly, there's the content type- it didn't come from a file!
